feedback.p: Correct. Blood cells are formed in the bone marrow in a process called hematopoiesis.
Incorrect. Bones are reorganized by bone cells, but this is not hematopoiesis.
Incorrect. Body movement is called translocation or locomotion, not hematopoiesis.
Incorrect. The spinal column is formed very early in human development; hematopoiesis occurs throughout life.

body.p: Which structure in the skeletal system is responsible for linking bones to other bones to stabilize the articulation?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Bones support load.
Incorrect. Cartilage cushions the articulation.
Incorrect. Tendons connect bones to muscles.
Correct. The collagen-containing ligaments stabilize articulations.

body.p: Which structure in the skeletal system is responsible for lubrication and shock absorption?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Bones support load.
Correct. The high water content in cartilage helps with lubrication and shock absorption.
Incorrect. Tendons connect bones to muscles.
Incorrect. Ligaments stabilize joints.

body.p: Which structure in the skeletal system is responsible for connecting bones to muscles?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Bones support load.
Incorrect. Cartilage cushions the articulation.
Correct. Stiff collagen filaments in tendons transmit loads from muscle to bones.
Incorrect. The less-stiff collagen-containing ligaments stabilize articulations.

body.p: Which direction is a majority of the appendicular skeleton from the axial skeleton?

feedback.p: Correct. The limbs are distal from the central part of the body.
Incorrect. Anterior means toward the front of the body, not the extremities.
Incorrect. Posterior means toward the back of the body, not the extremities.
Incorrect. Inferior means toward the feet, but the appendicular skeleton includes all the extremities, not just the legs and feet.

content.p: Choose if the following word is part of the axial or appendicular skeleton, or if it is not a bone at all.

response.feedback: Correct. The mandible is the jaw bone, part of the cranium.
Incorrect. The mandible is the jaw bone, part of the cranium.
Incorrect. The mandible is the jaw bone, part of the cranium.

no_response.feedback: You did not answer the question.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The fibula is in the leg.
Correct. The fibula is in the leg.
Incorrect. The fibula is a bone in the leg.

no_response.feedback: You did not answer the question.

response.feedback: Correct. The sternum is in the chest.
Incorrect. The sternum is in the chest.
Incorrect. The sternum is a bone in the chest.

no_response.feedback: You did not answer the question.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The pectoral girdle is located centrally, but it is considered part of the extremities.
Correct. The pectoral girdle is located centrally, but it is considered part of the extremities.
Incorrect. The pectoral girdle is a bone located centrally, but considered part of the extremities.

no_response.feedback: You did not answer the question.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Cruciate refers to the cruciate ligament, which is not a bone.
Incorrect. Cruciate refers to the cruciate ligament, which is not a bone.
Correct. Cruciate refers to the cruciate ligament, not a bone.

no_response.feedback: You did not answer the question.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Like the pectoral girdle, the scapula is part of the appendicular skeleton.
Correct. Like the pectoral girdle, the scapula is part of the appendicular skeleton.
Incorrect. Like the pectoral girdle, the scapula is a bone and is part of the appendicular skeleton.

no_response.feedback: You did not answer the question.

body.p: Which part of the skeletal system has more articulations with greater range of motion?

feedback.p: Incorrect. The axial skeleton is central, and the appendicular skeleton includes the extremities, which tend to move more.
Correct. The extremities move much more than the central skeleton.
Incorrect. The extremities move much more than the central skeleton.

body.p: The axial skeleton is associated with which function?

feedback.p: Correct. In addition to maintaining the bodyâ€™s center, the axial skeleton protects the centrally located organs.
Incorrect. The appendicular skeleton is responsible for movement, touching, etc.
Incorrect. Most of the bone marrow is found in the long bones of the appendicular skeleton.
Incorrect. The appendicular skeleton contains most of the body's bone marrow and is responsible for supporting most functions responsible for interacting with the environment.

body.p: Which classification of bone tissue has trabeculae?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Osteons are formed in compact bone.
Correct. Lamellae form trabeculae in spongy bone.
Incorrect. Only one of these classifications of bone has trabeculae.
Incorrect. One of these classifications of bone has trabeculae.

content.p: Choose the correct bone type for each of the following questions.

multiple_choice.body: What type of bone is the carpal?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Long bones are long, but the carpal bone in the wrist is a similar length in all directions.
Correct. The carpal bone in the wrist is a similar length in all directions.
Incorrect. Flat bones are plate-like.
Incorrect. The carpal bone is small and not especially strange in shape.

no_response.feedback: You did not answer the question.

multiple_choice.body: What type of bone is the femur?

response.feedback: Correct. The thigh bone in the leg is a long bone.
Incorrect. The thigh bone tends to be long in relation to the other bones in the body.
Incorrect. The thigh bone tends to be long in relation to the other bones in the body.
Incorrect. The thigh bone is relatively regular in shape.

no_response.feedback: You did not answer the question.

multiple_choice.body: which type of bone forms the skull?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Long bones are asymmetrical.
Incorrect.
Correct. The skull is flat and plate-like.
Incorrect. The skull is flat; and while the skull is slightly irregular, it is not as oddly shaped as something like the vertebrae.

no_response.feedback: You did not answer the question.

multiple_choice.body: What type of bone is the humerus?

response.feedback: Correct. The humerus in the upper arm is a long bone.
Incorrect. The bone in the upper arm is quite long in relation to the other bones in the body.
Incorrect. The bone in the upper arm is quite long in relation to the other bones in the body.
Incorrect. The bone in the upper arm is relatively regular.

no_response.feedback: You did not answer the question.

multiple_choice.body: What type of bones are the vertebrae?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The vertebrae in the spinal column are among the most irregular bones in the body.
Incorrect. The vertebrae in the spinal column are among the most irregular bones in the body.
Incorrect. The vertebrae in the spinal column are among the most irregular bones in the body.
Correct. The vertebrae in the spinal column are among the most irregular bones in the body.

no_response.feedback: You did not answer the question.

multiple_choice.body: What type of bone is the hip bone?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The hip connects to the femur, which is a long bone.
Incorrect. The hip is not roughly the same length in every dimension.
Incorrect. The hip is curved, not flat.
Correct. The irregular bone of the hip allows for the ball and socket articulation.

no_response.feedback: You did not answer the question.

body.p: What is the transition between the diaphysis and epiphysis called?

feedback.p: Correct. This transition is caused by bone formation from different sides.
Incorrect. This is not the precise answer. It is a disk of cartilage, but its anatomical name is the metaphysis.
Incorrect. Red bone marrow is inside the spongy bone.
Incorrect. The yellow bone marrow is in the medullary cavity between the metaphysis and diaphysis.

body.p: What are two major bones of the skull?

feedback.p: Incorrect. The hyoid is a bone found in the neck. The cranium is one of the two major bones of the skull.
Incorrect. The hyoid is a bone found in the neck. The mandible is one of the two major bones of the skull.
Incorrect. The occicles are found in the skull, but these are inner ear bones and not major bones. The cranium is one of the two major bones of the skull.
Incorrect. The occicles are found in the skull, but these are inner ear bones and not major bones. The cranium is one of the two major bones of the skull.

body.p: Which of the following is the correct function of the ribs?

input.choice: Provides protection for the organs of the upper body
Provides protection for the spinal cord

feedback.p: Incorrect. This is the function of the mandible.
Correct. Providing protection for the organs of the upper body is the function of the ribs.
Incorrect. This is the function of the vertebrae.
Incorrect. This is the function of the cranium.

body.p: Which of the following are parts of the thoracic cage?

feedback.p: Correct. The ribs and sternum are both parts of the thoracic cage.
Incorrect. The ribs are part of the thoracic cage but the vertebrae are part of the spine or vertebral column
Incorrect. The ribs are part of the thoracic cage but the Cranium is part of the skull.
Incorrect. The ribs are part of the thoracic cage but the mandible is part of the skull.

body.p: What are two major bones of the pectoral girdle?

feedback.p: Correct. The clavicle and scapula are the two major bones of the pectoral girdle.
Incorrect. The two coxal bones are part of the pelvic girdle.
Incorrect. The tibia and fibula are bones of the lower leg.
Incorrect. The ilium and ischium are parts of the two coxal bones of the pelvic girdle.

body.p: Which bone is located on the lateral side of the forearm between the elbow and wrist?

feedback.p: Incorrect. The ulna is on the medial side of the forearm between the elbow and wrist.
Correct. The radius is on the lateral side of the forearm between the elbow and wrist.
Incorrect. The humerus extends from the scapula to the elbow.
Incorrect.

body.p: Which of the following bones is properly matched with its function?

input.choice: Scapula -- provide attachment for ligaments that allow movement of the wrist
Femur -- supports the movement of the forearm
Clavicle -- helps keep the shoulder in place
Ulna -- articulate with the clavicle and the humerus

feedback.p: Incorrect. The scapula is in the shoulder and articulates with the clavicle and humerus.
Incorrect. The femur provides attachment for the muscles of the lower limbs and buttocks.
Correct. The clavicle helps keep the shoulder in place.
Incorrect. The ulna forms the medial side of the forearm between the elbow and wrist.
